<Link id="l02877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2877"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2878"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Type of BodyGen to use for region codegen</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2879"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2880"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Priv: If device pointer privatization is required, emit the body of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02881" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2881"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// region here. It will have to be duplicated: with and without</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02882" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2882"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// privatization.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02883" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2883"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// DupNoPriv: If we need device pointer privatization, we need</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02884" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2884"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// to emit the body of the region with no privatization in the &#39;else&#39; branch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02885" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2885"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of the conditional.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02886" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2886"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// NoPriv: If we don&#39;t require privatization of device</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02887" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2887"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pointers, we emit the body in between the runtime calls. This avoids</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02888" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2888"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// duplicating the body code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02889" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2889"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> BodyGenTy &#123; Priv, DupNoPriv, NoPriv &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02890" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2890"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02891" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2891"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Callback type for creating the map infos for the kernel parameters.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02892" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2892"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param CodeGenIP is the insertion point where code should be generated,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02893" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2893"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///        if any.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02894" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2894"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight">GenMapInfoCallbackTy =</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2895"><span class="doxyHighlight">      function&#95;ref&lt;MapInfosTy &amp;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a> CodeGenIP)&gt;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2896"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02897" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2897"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">private</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02898" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2898"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Emit the array initialization or deletion portion for user-defined mapper</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02899" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2899"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// code generation. First, it evaluates whether an array section is mapped</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02900" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2900"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// and whether the \\a MapType instructs to delete this section. If \\a IsInit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02901" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2901"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// is true, and \\a MapType indicates to not delete this array, array</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02902" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2902"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// initialization code is generated. If \\a IsInit is false, and \\a MapType</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02903" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2903"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// indicates to delete this array, array deletion code is generated.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02904" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2904"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> emitUDMapperArrayInitOrDel(Function &#42;MapperFn, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">llvm::Value</a> &#42;MapperHandle,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02905" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2905"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">llvm::Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sampleprof/#a702f69807459cc25db5754a5f179d3fcaf6fbeb8fa9f451468611536b00878d41">Base</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">llvm::Value</a> &#42;Begin,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02906" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2906"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">llvm::Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">llvm::Value</a> &#42;MapType,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02907" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2907"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">llvm::Value</a> &#42;MapName, TypeSize ElementSize,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02908" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2908"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                  llvm::BasicBlock &#42;ExitBB, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> IsInit);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02909" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2909"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02910" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2910"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02911" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2911"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Emit the user-defined mapper function. The code generation follows the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2912"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pattern in the example below.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2913"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2914"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// void .omp&#95;mapper.&lt;type&#95;name&gt;.&lt;mapper&#95;id&gt;.(void &#42;rt&#95;mapper&#95;handle,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02915" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2915"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                                           void &#42;base, void &#42;begin,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02916" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2916"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                                           int64&#95;t size, int64&#95;t type,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2917"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                                           void &#42;name = nullptr) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2918"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   // Allocate space for an array section first or add a base/begin for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2919"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   // pointer dereference.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2920"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   if ((size &gt; 1 || (base != begin &amp;&amp; maptype.IsPtrAndObj)) &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2921"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///       !maptype.IsDelete)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2922"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     &#95;&#95;tgt&#95;push&#95;mapper&#95;component(rt&#95;mapper&#95;handle, base, begin,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2923"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                                 size&#42;sizeof(Ty), clearToFromMember(type));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2924"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   // Map members.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2925"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   for (unsigned i = 0; i &lt; size; i++) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02926" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2926"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     // For each component specified by this mapper:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02927" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2927"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     for (auto c : begin&#91;i&#93;-&gt;all&#95;components) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02928" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2928"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///       if (c.hasMapper())</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2929"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///         (&#42;c.Mapper())(rt&#95;mapper&#95;handle, c.arg&#95;base, c.arg&#95;begin,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2930"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///         c.arg&#95;size,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2931"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                       c.arg&#95;type, c.arg&#95;name);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2932"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///       else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2933"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///         &#95;&#95;tgt&#95;push&#95;mapper&#95;component(rt&#95;mapper&#95;handle, c.arg&#95;base,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2934"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                                     c.arg&#95;begin, c.arg&#95;size, c.arg&#95;type,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2935"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                                     c.arg&#95;name);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2936"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2937"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2938"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   // Delete the array section.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2939"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   if (size &gt; 1 &amp;&amp; maptype.IsDelete)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2940"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     &#95;&#95;tgt&#95;push&#95;mapper&#95;component(rt&#95;mapper&#95;handle, base, begin,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2941"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                                 size&#42;sizeof(Ty), clearToFromMember(type));</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2942"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2943"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2944"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2945"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param PrivAndGenMapInfoCB Callback that privatizes code and populates the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2946"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// MapInfos and returns.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2947"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param ElemTy DeclareMapper element type.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2948"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param FuncName Optional param to specify mapper function name.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2949"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param CustomMapperCB Optional callback to generate code related to</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2951"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/codeview/#adfebd8c4ae29ccd84c600c1e65d6b807a86408593c34af77fdd90df932f8b5261">Function</a> &#42;emitUserDefinedMapper(</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3048"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Declarations for LLVM-IR types (simple, array, function and structure) are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3049"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// generated below. Their names are defined and used in OpenMPKinds.def. Here</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3050"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// we provide the declarations, the initializeTypes function will provide the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3051"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// values.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3052"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3053"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3054"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define OMP&#95;TYPE(VarName, InitValue) Type &#42;VarName = nullptr;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3055"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define OMP&#95;ARRAY&#95;TYPE(VarName, ElemTy, ArraySize)                             \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3056"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  ArrayType &#42;VarName##Ty = nullptr;                                            \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3057"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PointerType &#42;VarName##PtrTy = nullptr;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3058"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define OMP&#95;FUNCTION&#95;TYPE(VarName, IsVarArg, ReturnType, ...)                  \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3059"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  FunctionType &#42;VarName = nullptr;                                             \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3060"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PointerType &#42;VarName##Ptr = nullptr;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3061"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define OMP&#95;STRUCT&#95;TYPE(VarName, StrName, ...)                                 \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3062"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  StructType &#42;VarName = nullptr;                                               \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3063"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  PointerType &#42;VarName##Ptr = nullptr;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3064"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;llvm/Frontend/OpenMP/OMPKinds.def&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3065"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3066"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///&#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3143"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Callback type for Atomic Expression update</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3144"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// ex:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\code&#123;.cpp&#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// x = Expr(x&#95;old);  //Expr() is any legal operation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3171"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Emit atomic update for constructs: X = X BinOp Expr ,or X = Expr BinOp X</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3172"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// For complex Operations: X = UpdateOp(X) =&gt; CmpExch X, old&#95;X, UpdateOp(X)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3173"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Only Scalar data types.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3174"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3175"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param AllocaIP   The insertion point to be used for alloca</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3176"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                   instructions.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3312"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if (x ordop expr) &#123; x = expr; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3313"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if (expr ordop x) &#123; x = expr; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3314"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if (x == e) &#123; x = d; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3315"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if (e == x) &#123; x = d; &#125; (this one is not in the spec)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3316"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// conditional-update-capture-atomic:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3317"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// v = x; cond-update-stmt; (IsPostfixUpdate=true, IsFailOnly=false)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3318"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// cond-update-stmt; v = x; (IsPostfixUpdate=false, IsFailOnly=false)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3319"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// if (x == e) &#123; x = d; &#125; else &#123; v = x; &#125; (IsPostfixUpdate=false,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3320"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                                         IsFailOnly=true)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3321"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// r = x == e; if (r) &#123; x = d; &#125; (IsPostfixUpdate=false, IsFailOnly=false)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3322"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// r = x == e; if (r) &#123; x = d; &#125; else &#123; v = x; &#125; (IsPostfixUpdate=false,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                                                IsFailOnly=true)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3324"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3325"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param Loc          The insert and source location description.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3326"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param X            The target atomic pointer to be updated.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3327"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param V            Memory address where to store captured value (for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     compare capture only).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param R            Memory address where to store comparison result</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3330"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     (for compare capture with &#39;==&#39; only).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3331"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param E            The expected value (&#39;e&#39;) for forms that use an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3332"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     equality comparison or an expression (&#39;expr&#39;) for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3333"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     forms that use &#39;ordop&#39; (logically an atomic maximum or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3334"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     minimum).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3335"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param D            The desired value for forms that use an equality</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3336"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     comparison. If forms that use &#39;ordop&#39;, it should be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3337"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     \\p nullptr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3338"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param AO           Atomic ordering of the generated atomic instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3339"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param Op           Atomic compare operation. It can only be ==, &lt;, or &gt;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3340"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param IsXBinopExpr True if the conditional statement is in the form where</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03341" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3341"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     x is on LHS. It only matters for &lt; or &gt;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3342"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param IsPostfixUpdate  True if original value of &#39;x&#39; must be stored in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3343"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                         &#39;v&#39;, not an updated one (for compare capture</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3344"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                         only).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3345"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\param IsFailOnly   True if the original value of &#39;x&#39; is stored to &#39;v&#39;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3346"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     only when the comparison fails. This is only valid for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03347" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3347"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///                     the case the comparison is &#39;==&#39;.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03348" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3348"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03349" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3349"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// \\return Insertion point after generated atomic capture IR.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03350" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3350"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/openmpirbuilder/#aafc1886793b898052f87edd7e9fdbaa3">InsertPointTy</a></span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3363"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Create the control flow structure of a canonical OpenMP loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3364"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3365"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The emitted loop will be disconnected, i.e. no edge to the loop&#39;s</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3404"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Gets (if variable with the given name already exist) or creates</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3411"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                              </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/nvptxas/#ad7d00b71af84502be65ae2de3f8d91dc">AddressSpace</a> = 0);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3412"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3413"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3414"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Class to represented the control flow structure of an OpenMP canonical loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3415"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3416"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The control-flow structure is standardized for easy consumption by</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3417"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// directives associated with loops. For instance, the worksharing-loop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3418"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// construct may change this control flow such that each loop iteration is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3419"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// executed on only one thread. The constraints of a canonical loop in brief</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3420"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// are:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3421"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3422"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; The number of loop iterations must have been computed before entering the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3423"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3424"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3425"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; Has an (unsigned) logical induction variable that starts at zero and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3426"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    increments by one.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3427"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3428"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  &#42; The loop&#39;s CFG itself has no side-effects. The OpenMP specification</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3429"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    itself allows side-effects, but the order in which they happen, including</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3430"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    how often or whether at all, is unspecified. We expect that the frontend</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3431"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    will emit those side-effect instructions somewhere (e.g. before the loop)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3432"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    such that the CanonicalLoopInfo itself can be side-effect free.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3433"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3434"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Keep in mind that CanonicalLoopInfo is meant to only describe a repeated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3435"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// execution of a loop body that satifies these constraints. It does NOT</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3436"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// represent arbitrary SESE regions that happen to contain a loop. Do not use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3437"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// CanonicalLoopInfo for such purposes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3438"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3439"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The control flow can be described as follows:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3440"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3441"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///     Preheader</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3442"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///        |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3443"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  /-&gt; Header</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3444"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  |     |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3445"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  |    Cond---\\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3446"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  |     |     |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3447"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  |    Body   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03448" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3448"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  |    | |    |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03449" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3449"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  |   &lt;...&gt;   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3450"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///  |    | |    |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3451"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   \\--Latch   |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03452" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3452"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3453"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///             Exit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3454"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///              |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03455" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3455"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///            After</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03456" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3456"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03457" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3457"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The loop is thought to start at PreheaderIP (at the Preheader&#39;s terminator,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03458" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3458"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// including) and end at AfterIP (at the After&#39;s first instruction, excluding).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3459"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// That is, instructions in the Preheader and After blocks (except the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3460"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Preheader&#39;s terminator) are out of CanonicalLoopInfo&#39;s control and may have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03461" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3461"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// side-effects. Typically, the Preheader is used to compute the loop&#39;s trip</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03462" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3462"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// count. The instructions from BodyIP (at the Body block&#39;s first instruction,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03463" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3463"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// excluding) until the Latch are also considered outside CanonicalLoopInfo&#39;s</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03464" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3464"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// control and thus can have side-effects. The body block is the single entry</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03465" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3465"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// point into the loop body, which may contain arbitrary control flow as long</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03466" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3466"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// as all control paths eventually branch to the Latch block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3467"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3468"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TODO: Consider adding another standardized BasicBlock between Body CFG and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3469"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Latch to guarantee that there is only a single edge to the latch. It would</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3470"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// make loop transformations easier to not needing to consider multiple</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3471"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// predecessors of the latch (See redirectAllPredecessorsTo) and would give us</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3472"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// an equivalant to PreheaderIP, AfterIP and BodyIP for inserting code that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3473"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// executes after each body iteration.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3474"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3475"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// There must be no loop-carried dependencies through llvm::Values. This is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3476"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// equivalant to that the Latch has no PHINode and the Header&#39;s only PHINode is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3477"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// for the induction variable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3478"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3479"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// All code in Header, Cond, Latch and Exit (plus the terminator of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3480"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Preheader) are CanonicalLoopInfo&#39;s responsibility and their build-up checked</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3481"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// by assertOK(). They are expected to not be modified unless explicitly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3482"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// modifying the CanonicalLoopInfo through a methods that applies a OpenMP</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3483"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// loop-associated construct such as applyWorkshareLoop, tileLoops, unrollLoop,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3484"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// etc. These methods usually invalidate the CanonicalLoopInfo and re-use its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3485"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// basic blocks. After invalidation, the CanonicalLoopInfo must not be used</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3486"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// anymore as its underlying control flow may not exist anymore.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3487"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Loop-transformation methods such as tileLoops, collapseLoops and unrollLoop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3488"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// may also return a new CanonicalLoopInfo that can be passed to other</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3489"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// loop-associated construct implementing methods. These loop-transforming</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3490"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// methods may either create a new CanonicalLoopInfo usually using</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3491"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// createLoopSkeleton and invalidate the input CanonicalLoopInfo, or reuse and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3492"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// modify one of the input CanonicalLoopInfo and return it as representing the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3493"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// modified loop. What is done is an implementation detail of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3494"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// transformation-implementing method and callers should always assume that the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3495"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// CanonicalLoopInfo passed to it is invalidated and a new object is returned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3496"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Returned CanonicalLoopInfo have the same structure and guarantees as the one</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3497"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// created by createCanonicalLoop, such that transforming methods do not have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3498"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to special case where the CanonicalLoopInfo originated from.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3499"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3500"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Generally, methods consuming CanonicalLoopInfo do not need an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3501"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// OpenMPIRBuilder::InsertPointTy as argument, but use the locations of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3502"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// CanonicalLoopInfo to insert new or modify existing instructions. Unless</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3503"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// documented otherwise, methods consuming CanonicalLoopInfo do not invalidate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3504"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// any InsertPoint that is outside CanonicalLoopInfo&#39;s control. Specifically,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3505"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// any InsertPoint in the Preheader, After or Block can still be used after</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03506" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3506"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// calling such a method.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03507" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3507"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03508" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3508"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// TODO: Provide mechanisms for exception handling and cancellation points.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03509" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3509"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03510" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3510"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Defined outside OpenMPIRBuilder because nested classes cannot be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03511" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3511"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// forward-declared, e.g. to avoid having to include the entire OMPIRBuilder.h.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03512" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3512" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo">CanonicalLoopInfo</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03513" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3513" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a1ce8ab76394bc6773081e7634cd20625"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">friend</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a1ce8ab76394bc6773081e7634cd20625">OpenMPIRBuilder</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03514" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3514"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03517" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3517"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03519" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3519"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;Exit = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03520" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3520"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03521" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3521"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Add the control blocks of this loop to \\p BBs.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03531" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3531"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Sets the number of loop iterations to the given value. This value must be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3532"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// valid in the condition block (i.e., defined in the preheader) and is</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3534"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> setTripCount(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;TripCount);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3535"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3536"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Replace all uses of the canonical induction variable in the loop body with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3537"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a new one.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3538"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3539"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The intended use case is to update the induction variable for an updated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3540"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// iteration space such that it can stay normalized in the 0...tripcount-1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3541"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// range.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3542"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3543"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The \\p Updater is called with the (presumable updated) current normalized</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3544"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// induction variable and is expected to return the value that uses of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3545"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// pre-updated induction values should use instead, typically dependent on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3546"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the new induction variable. This is a lambda (instead of e.g. just passing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3547"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the new value) to be able to distinguish the uses of the pre-updated</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3548"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// induction variable and uses of the induction varible to compute the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3549"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// updated induction variable value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3550"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> mapIndVar(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function-ref">llvm::function&#95;ref</a>&lt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;)&gt; Updater);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3553"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Returns whether this object currently represents the IR of a loop. If</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3554"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// returning false, it may have been consumed by a loop transformation or not</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3555"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// been intialized. Do not use in this case;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3556" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a4b2b7074e300c251f7cb8913620b1d80"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a4b2b7074e300c251f7cb8913620b1d80">isValid</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Header; &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3557"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3558"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The preheader ensures that there is only a single edge entering the loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3559"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Code that must be execute before any loop iteration can be emitted here,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3560"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// such as computing the loop trip count and begin lifetime markers. Code in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3561"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the preheader is not considered part of the canonical loop.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3562"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#ad50eb30e70ff2a9ea7f220547e2b6f6d">getPreheader</a>() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3563"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3564"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The header is the entry for each iteration. In the canonical control flow,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3565"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// it only contains the PHINode for the induction variable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3566" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a01c4471afa921c4962d7138cfcef4942"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a01c4471afa921c4962d7138cfcef4942">getHeader</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3570"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3571"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The condition block computes whether there is another loop iteration. If</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3573" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#acb5b5b136597312e0d5df6b746a7e6db"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#acb5b5b136597312e0d5df6b746a7e6db">getCond</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3576"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3577"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3578"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The body block is the single entry for a loop iteration and not controlled</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3579"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// by CanonicalLoopInfo. It can contain arbitrary control flow but must</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3581" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a47521ec347ef7b522745bf89e2e2d19a"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a47521ec347ef7b522745bf89e2e2d19a">getBody</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3582"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a4b2b7074e300c251f7cb8913620b1d80">isValid</a>() &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Requires a valid canonical loop&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3583"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;BranchInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/riscv/riscvredundantcopyelimination-cpp/#a193847098793cdbab306803186676899">Cond</a>-&gt;getTerminator())-&gt;getSuccessor(0);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3584"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3585"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3586"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Reaching the latch indicates the end of the loop body code. In the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3587"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// canonical control flow, it only contains the increment of the induction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3588"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// variable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3589" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#ac37a6cf77f6f82b6bb28af4d9c8626d0"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#ac37a6cf77f6f82b6bb28af4d9c8626d0">getLatch</a>()</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3590"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/canonicalloopinfo/#a4b2b7074e300c251f7cb8913620b1d80">isValid</a>() &amp;&amp; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Requires a valid canonical loop&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
